alert.note: Alert for Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 1:14PM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera
